ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to better tailor my narrative to elicit specific effects from the reader. Prof Shore's insights on the writing process focused on how to construct a story, and why to employ/forgo certain writing strategies. Her comments on the book reviews and additions to class discussion were extremely useful, and made me more confident as a writer. I feel that my approach to creating a narrative is more focused, and that I have a stronger sense of the reader's perspective.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The reading was broad and interesting, and discussion was always lively. Prof Shore's contributions to discussion were so helpful, particularly with some of the more difficult reading (Zizek, for example). The only real improvement I can think of is to maybe limit the number of participants; with such a large group, some students rarely contributed.

The class size was too large for the way the course was structured. This meant that group engagement/ discussion was difficult. There was therefore a lot of time spent listening to the Professor, rather than there being dialogues between the students. Despite being a course that was supposedly centred around writing, there was little engagement with writing techniques for intellectual history.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Even if another student wasn't interested in the reading list, I would still recommend this course for the quality of class discussion and interaction with the texts.
